intro: Melissitus laxiflorus, commonly known as the slender-flowered melissitus, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
